description.p: The invention relates to a B-pillar for a vehicle with an upper fastening portion for fastening to a roof member and a lower fastening portion for fastening to a sill member, the main portion of the B-pillar of predominantly martensitic structure having an ultimate strength of at least 1300 MPa and a less strong lower portion of the pillar having an tensile strength of not more than 800 MPa and only a small proportion of martensite.

heading.b: Background to and purpose and object of the invention

description.p: The pillar to the rear of the forward door of a vehicle is called a B-pillar. The pillar is substantially intended to provide protection in lateral collisions, and controlled deformation of it in a lateral collision is desired for best possible passenger protection. EP-1 180 470 A1 refers to a B-pillar which has a soft lower portion and promotes a controlled mode of deformation. US 6,820,924 refers to a B-pillar which has two very narrow soft band as deformation triggers at a distance from the lower fastening portion of the pillar.

The object of the invention is to further improve a B-pillar, and in accordance with the invention the less strong portion has a height of at least 30 mm, extends less than 1/3 of total height of the pillar, and is so positioned that the lower fastening portion is predominantly martensitic. The invention is defined by the claims.

heading.b: Description of depicted and preferred embodiment example of the invention

description.p: The B-pillar 11 depicted in the drawings is shaped from a planar steel blank and is of substantially hat-beam shape with varying cross-section along its length. The top of the pillar has a transverse profile constituting a fastening portion 12 adapted to being welded to the vehicle's longitudinal roof member 13. The bottom of the pillar has a transverse profile constituting a fastening portion adapted to being welded to the vehicle's sill member 15. The roof member 13 and the sill member 15 are not depicted in Figure 1.

The pillar 11 has various necessary holes, e.g. fastening holes 16 for fastening the hinge of the rear door, fastening holes 17 for fastening the striker plate for the lock of the rear door, and a hole 18 for cable leadthrough.

The major length of the pillar is hardened into predominantly martensitic structure and the steel has a tensile strength of at least 1300 MPa, preferably at least 1400 MPa, but the pillar has a softer transverse band 20 with an tensile strength of less than 800 MPa. This band has a different structure, e.g. a mixture of perlite, ferrite, bainite and annealed martensite. The band has a height h of at least 30 mm and extends less than 1/3, or preferably less than ¼, of the total height of the pillar. On both sides of the band there are transition zones to the unannealed martensite structure. The soft band 20 should not reach to the lowest portion of the pillar, since at least the fastening portion 14 to the sill should be predominantly martensitic and of high strength.

Figure 4 depicts schematically the deformation of the pillar when subjected to a collision load represented by an arrow in the diagram. The relatively narrow band 20 may have a height of less than 400 mm or less than 200 mm and is situated in the lower half, or preferably the lowest third, of the pillar, and the low positioning of the band promotes the desired deformation behaviour protecting the passenger's hip area without weakening the fastening of the pillar to the sill member. The original state of the pillar is represented by a broken line.

The pillar 11 is with advantage made by the press-hardening method, i.e. it is hot-formed in a cooled pair of tools and maintained in the tools with the tools serving as a fixture until the pillar has hardened. There are various different ways of preventing rapid cooling, and hence preventing hardening, of the band 20. Some ways of preventing rapid cooling of specific portions of the product in the press-hardening method, such as the use of recesses or inserts in the pair of tools or heating of specific parts of the pair of tools, is described in GB 2313848 and US 3,703,093.

In a preferred method, a blank of flat sheet steel is heated in a furnace to austenitic state and moved into a cooled pair of shaping tools and stamped into shape. The shaped pillar is then maintained in the tools until it has hardened into an essentially martensitic structure with a tensile strength of at least 1300 MPa. A portion of each tool adjacent the portion 20 of the pillar is heated and kept at such a temperature that the portion 20 is prevented from rapid cooling and will only reach a tensile strength of less than 800 MPa.

The press-hardening method does not result in the surface finish and tolerances desired for painted sheetmetal surfaces. The painted side 21 of the bodywork is therefore usually form-pressed in such a way that it conceals the pillar 11, as illustrated in Figure 3. The vehicle side 21 is spot-welded or bonded to side flanges 22, 23 of the pillar 11. Thin sheetmetal 24 is also usually fastened on the inside and is thereafter covered with upholstery, but the pillar 11 constitutes the structural B-pillar. On a completed vehicle, the pillar 11 will therefore not be visible and what is visible will be the sheetmetal 21 on the outside and the upholstery on the inside. This unit is then referred to as the B-pillar although it is only the portion 11 which is the structural pillar, although the sheet 24 contributes somewhat to the strength by preventing the hat profile from flatten out..

claim.claim-text: B-Säule für ein Fahrzeug, die einen oberen Befestigungsabschnitt (12) zum Befestigen eines Dachelements (13) und einen unteren Befestigungsabschnitt (14) zum Befestigen eines Schweller-Elements (15) aufweist, wobei der Hauptabschnitt der B-Säule aus einer vorwiegend martensitischen Struktur mit einer Zugfestigkeit von wenigstens 1300 MPa besteht und ein weniger fester unterer Abschnitt (20) der Säule eine Zugfestigkeit von nicht mehr als 800 MPa aufweist, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass der weniger feste Abschnitt (20) eine Höhe von mehr als 30 mm aufweist, sich weniger als 1/3 der Gesamthöhe der Säule erstreckt und derart positioniert ist, dass der untere Befestigungsabschnitt (14) vorwiegend martensitisch ist.
B-Säule gemäß Anspruch 1, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass der weniger feste Abschnitt (14) eine Höhe von weniger als 1/4 der Gesamthöhe der Säule aufweist.
B-Säule gemäß Anspruch 1, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass der weniger feste Abschnitt eine Höhe von zwischen 50 und 200 mm aufweist.
B-Säule gemäß einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die B-Säule eine Zugfestigkeit von wenigstens 1400 MPa aufweist.

Verfahren zum Formen einer B-Säule für ein Fahrzeug durch Heißformen eines austenitischen Rohlings aus Stahlblech in einem gekühlten Paar von Werkzeugen und Halten der geformten Säule in dem gekühlten Paar von Werkzeugen, bis sie in eine im Wesentlichen martensitische Struktur mit einer Zugfestigkeit von wenigstens 1300 MPa ausgehärtet ist,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass ein Abschnitt (20) mit einer Höhe von 30-400 mm daran gehindert wird schnell abzukühlen, so dass er eine Zugfestigkeit von weniger als 800 MPa erreicht und der Abschnitt an der unteren Hälfte der Säule über einem Bodenabschnitt (14) positioniert ist, der eine Zugfestigkeit von wenigstens 1300 MPa aufweisen wird.

A B-pillar for a vehicle, comprising an upper fastening portion (12) for fastening to a roof member (13), and a lower fastening portion (14) for fastening to a sill member (15), the main portion of the B-pillar being of predominantly martensitic structure with a tensile strength of at least 1300 MPa and a less strong lower portion (20) of the pillar having a tensile strength of not more than 800 MPa, characterised in that the less strong portion (20) has a height of more than 30 mm, extends less than 1/3 of total height of the pillar, and is so positioned that the lower fastening portion (14) is predominantly martensitic.
A B-pillar according to claim 1, characterised in that the less strong portion (14) has a height of less than ¼ of the total height of the pillar.
A B-pillar according to claim 1, characterised in that the less strong portion has a height of between 50 and 200 mm.
A B-pillar according to any one of the above claims, characterised in that the B-pillar has an tensile strength of at least 1400 MPa.

A method of shaping a B-pillar for a vehicle by hot-shaping an austenitic blank of sheet steel in a cooled pair of tools and keeping the shaped pillar in the cooled pair of tools until it has hardened into an essentially martensitic structure with a tensile strength of at least 1300 MPa,
characterised in
that a portion (20) with a height of 30-400 mm is prevented from rapid cooling such that it will reach a tensile strength of less than 800 MPa and said portion is positioned at the lower half of the pillar above a bottom portion (14), which will have a tensile strength of at least 1300 MPa.

Montant B pour un véhicule, comprenant une portion de fixation supérieure (12) pour la fixation à un élément de toit (13), et une portion de fixation inférieure (14) pour la fixation à un élément de rebord (15), la portion principale du montant B étant d'une structure de prédominance martensitique avec une résistance à la traction d'au moins 1300 MPa, et une portion inférieure moins résistante (20) du montant ayant une résistance à la traction non supérieure à 800 MPa, caractérisé en ce que la portion moins résistante (20) a une hauteur supérieure à 30 mm, s'étend sur moins que 1/3 de la hauteur totale du montant, et est positionnée de telle sorte que la portion de fixation inférieure (14) est en prédominance martensitique.
Montant B selon la revendication 1, caractérisé en ce que la portion moins résistante (14) a une hauteur inférieure à 1/4 de la hauteur totale du montant.
Montant B selon la revendication 1, caractérisé en ce que la portion moins résistante a une hauteur entre 50 et 200 mm.
Montant B selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, caractérisé en ce que le montant B a une résistance à la traction d'au moins 1400 MPa.

Procédé de configuration d'un montant B pour un véhicule par le formage à chaud d'une ébauche austénitique de tôle dans une paire d'outils refroidis et le maintien du montant configuré dans la paire d'outils refroidis jusqu'à ce qu'il ait durci en une structure essentiellement martensitique avec une résistance à la traction d'au moins 1300 MPa,
caractérisé en ce qu'une portion (20) d'une hauteur de 30-400 mm est empêchée de se refroidir rapidement de sorte qu'elle atteindra une résistance à la traction inférieure à 800 MPa, et ladite portion est positionnée à la moitié inférieure du montant au-dessus d'une portion de fond (14), qui aura une résistance à la traction d'au moins 1300 MPa.
